name: Grilled Tuna Burger With Ginger Mayonnaise
keywords: ginger, mayonnaise, tuna fillet, main course, summer
recipeIngredient: 4 4- to 5-ounce tuna steaks, each about 3/4-inch thick
Freshly ground black pepper or Sichuan peppercorns
Neutral oil, like grapeseed or corn

recipeInstructions.text: Start a gas or charcoal fire; heat should be moderately high and rack should be clean and about 4 inches from heat source. Brush each steak lightly with soy sauce and sprinkle with pepper. In a bowl, combine mayonnaise, fresh ginger, one teaspoon soy sauce and sesame oil if you are using it.
Oil grill grates lightly; grill tuna about 2 minutes per side for rare, proportionately longer if you want it better done. Toast buns if you like.
Serve fish on buns, spread with some ginger mayonnaise and topped with a bit of pickled ginger, if you like.
